text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-DeviceDefinition.guideline

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..1ExtensionInformation aimed at providing directions for the usage of this model of device
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:useContext 0..*ExtensionThe circumstances that form the setting for using the device
value[x] 0..1UsageContextThe circumstances that form the setting for using the device
extension:usageInstruction 0..1ExtensionDetailed written and visual directions for the user on how to use the device
value[x] 0..1markdownDetailed written and visual directions for the user on how to use the device
extension:relatedArtifact 0..*ExtensionA source of information or reference for this guideline
value[x] 0..1RelatedArtifactA source of information or reference for this guideline
extension:indication 0..*ExtensionA clinical condition for which the device was designed to be used
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptA clinical condition for which the device was designed to be used
extension:contraindication 0..*ExtensionA specific situation when a device should not be used because it may cause harm
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptA specific situation when a device should not be used because it may cause harm
extension:warning 0..*ExtensionSpecific hazard alert information that a user needs to know before using the device
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptSpecific hazard alert information that a user needs to know before using the device
extension:intendedUse 0..1ExtensionA description of the general purpose or medical use of the device or its function
value[x] 0..1stringA description of the general purpose or medical use of the device or its function
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-DeviceDefinition.guideline"

Documentation for this format

name: ext_R5_DeviceDefinition_guideline
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.DeviceDefinition.guideline for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents DeviceDefinition.guideline from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/DeviceDefinition|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: Information aimed at providing directions for the usage of this model of device
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).
